text.section:
A limited cooperative association has the officers:
Provided in the organic rules; or
Established by the board of directors in a manner not inconsistent with the organic rules.

The organic rules may designate or, if the rules do not designate, the board of directors shall designate, one (1) of the associationâ€™s officers for preparing all records required by KRS 272A.1-120 and for the authentication of records.
Unless the organic rules otherwise provide, the board of directors shall appoint the officers of the limited cooperative association.
Officers of a limited cooperative association shall perform the duties the organic rules prescribe or as authorized by the board of directors not in a manner inconsistent with the organic rules.
The election or appointment of an officer of a limited cooperative association does not of itself create a contract between the association and the officer.
Unless the organic rules otherwise provide, an individual may simultaneously hold more than one (1) office in a limited cooperative association.

law.history: Created 2012 Ky. Acts ch. 160, sec. 74, effective July 12, 2012.
